On Fri, 3 Oct 2003, Oisin Kim wrote:

> I've been looking to check that Junit runs tests serially, i.e. one at
> a  time, I've been told that there are occasions when JUnit runs tests
> concurrently, is this so? I can't see how this would be, as tests
> which access the DB would almost certainly fail if they were run
> conrrently.

JUnit itself never runs tests concurrently.  However, if the tests
themselves start separate threads, execution may not be serial.

To put this another way: JUnit does not guarantee that the software
that is under test contains no concurrent elements.
